channel.title: [Source]Modded PHProxy with login
channel.description:
So here is my modded PHProxy code!!!!
[b]Requirements:[/b] Just php
[b]Set up[/b] Find admin.php and open it.
Find the line [php] if(strtolower($_POST["username"]=="USERNAME") && md5(strtolower($_POST["password"])) === "MD5 PASSWORD"){[/php] its line 15
Make a username and generate a md5 password (use an online hasher) --------------- Make an account for yourself through registrations
Open logins.xml and copy the userinfo ex: [code]<train> <username>train</username> <password>7b935a6a6387ab3832aa5755de0cb820</password> <authorized>true</authorized> </train>[/code] into default logins.xml
so it looks like this [code] <?xml version='1.0' encoding='utf-8' ?> <userlist> <train> <username>train</username> <password>7b935a6a6387ab3832aa5755de0cb820</password> <authorized>true</authorized> </train> </userlist> [/code]
annnnd thats it you might want to close registrations now (through admin page) and just open when u want a friend to register [b] Notes:[/b] I did not make PHProxy or xml.inc.php (why should i reinvent the wheel) This code I added is not commented, because it was private but it was requested by some people so here it is.
[b]Download:[/b] train.cruels.net/proxy.zip

@Bang_Train wrote:

create a username and a md5 hash of a password
u can use this: http://epleweb.com/md5/
to make one.

as for it not loading a page when u hit go. im really not sure

Read full topic

item.title: [Source]Modded PHProxy with login
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:2, topic:152357”]Nice, Bang Train.

Though couldn’t you just have it look for a REQUEST variable, then die() if it doesn’t find it? Google wouldn’t automatically add a REQUEST variable, would it? You could have a cookie on your personal computer so you would never have to use it. It’s just that usernames and passwords piss me off.[/quote]
i delete my cookies a lot :P…for reasons i shall not disclose >.>

OnlyOneRule:

Nice, i wouldn’t be botherd writing that whole encrypt script :P, must have taken hours.

i had it lying around from an old php project
and it took about 2 days (first day i wrote half, and surfer wrote another encryption function. sencond, they were combined for extra sexy encryption)

Read full topic

Though couldn’t you just have it look for a REQUEST variable, then die() if it doesn’t find it? Google wouldn’t automatically add a REQUEST variable, would it? You could have a cookie on your personal computer so you would never have to use it. It’s just that usernames and passwords piss me off.

item.title: [Source]Modded PHProxy with login
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

So here is my modded PHProxy code!!!

Requirements:
Just php

Set up
Find admin.php and open it.

Find the line [php] if(strtolower($_POST[“username”]==“USERNAME”) && md5(strtolower($_POST[“password”])) === “MD5 PASSWORD”){[/php]
its line 15

Make a username and generate a md5 password (use an online hasher)

Make an account for yourself through registrations

Open logins.xml and copy the userinfo
ex:

<train> <username>train</username> <password>7b935a6a6387ab3832aa5755de0cb820</password> <authorized>true</authorized> </train>
into default logins.xml

so it looks like this

<?xml version='1.0' encoding='utf-8' ?>
<userlist>
<train>
<username>train</username>
<password>7b935a6a6387ab3832aa5755de0cb820</password>
<authorized>true</authorized>
</train>
</userlist>

annnnd thats it
you might want to close registrations now (through admin page) and just open when u want a friend to register

Notes:
I did not make PHProxy or xml.inc.php (why should i reinvent the wheel)
This code I added is not commented, because it was private but it was requested by some people so here it is.

Download:
train.cruels.net/proxy.zip

Read full topic
